creator: karin111@bellsouth.net
text:
I build apache against a Red Hat ES3 Server. Red Hat recently had a kernel
upgrade plus some gcc related upgrades.
I upgraded the apr's to 1.2.6 attempted to rebuild apache 2.2.0 but, have been
unsuccessful. Did not have the problem before the red hat upgrades. I am however
able to build apache 2.0.55.

Here are the results after attempting a simple build;

./configure \
> --prefix=/etc/httpd \
> --exec-prefix=/usr \
> --with-apr=/usr/bin/apr-1-config \
> --with-apr-util=/usr/bin/apu-1-config

text:
If I build with the addition of --with-pcre=/usr/local/pcre
My Results are:

The problem is whatever is doing this:

  adding "/iconv/include" to INCLUDES

what is the output of running:

 $ apu-1-config --includes

and separately,

 $ apr-1-config --includes

on this system?
creator: jorton@redhat.com
karin111@bellsouth.net
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
----------------------------------------------------------------
Well, I reconfigured the build process for apr, apr-util and apr-iconv to follow
the same path as httpd. I had problems with the ssl headers with httpd so I
added the includes for the ssl header. On my third build I got a successful build.

Problem resolved.
Thanks




----------------------------------------------------------------
